page.title: 02A DOCTORS DAY
page.content: On the 21st of May 1985 Doctor Clarke came in to talk to us. He has been a doctor for thirty years. He is in practice with two other doctors, and hopes to have another join them soon. Over one third of his patients are elderly, that is over sixtyfive. On average he he sees twentyfive to thirty people in the morning, and the same in the afternoon and also does about five house calls. The most common complaint is chest infections. He sends about one hundred people to the hospital per week for checkups, X rays, blood tests etc. To be a doctor you need to have 'O' and 'A' level qualifications and then a further seven years training. The things that have changed in the thirty years the Doctor Clake has been a doctor are facilities to speed up diagnosis and improved{CONTINUED......
